__e: Then what were you doing in our house that night?
This is the first time I've been alone with you since that wonderful night in Paris, and I love it.
This is from my dream, that night I came to your room. This is the music I heard in my head, somehow I gave it to you.
We never made it out of the house that night, did we?
It's not that you weren't there that night.
And I would have given my life, Lawrence, that you hadn't found us that night.

Well, at the time, sir, I was more frightened for my husband, for his safety and his sanity.
